name: Association of Cyprus Banks

goal: The ACB was established in 1969 and is the formal voice of the local banking sector. The ACB is a non-profit organization that represents and promotes the interests of its member banks concerning banking business and practices. The ACB puts forward its membersâ€™ views and positions when local legislative and governmental policies are determined. Common positions are formulated on several banking and financial issues, especially in compliance with EU regulations and guidelines. Currently, the ACB, has 10 members.
interests: Banking and financial services, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Fraud prevention, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation
euInitiatives: Digital Banking, Payment services, AML, Retail and consumer issues (mortgage credit, Payment Accounts Directive, Banking Supervision, Financial Education, Corporate Social Responsibility.
